elements.title: white-nosed saki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite its name, the white-nosed saki (pictured) actually has a reddish-pink nose?

elements.title: Adalgisa Gabbi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after finding success in Poland and South America, soprano Adalgisa Gabbi performed at La Scala as Eva in the Italian premiere of Wagner's Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg?

elements.title: Wrath Month (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the perceived tameness of LGBT Pride Month gave rise to Wrath Month?

elements.title: Kiyoe Yoshioka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kiyoe Yoshioka, the vocalist of the band Ikimonogakari, voiced an Eevee in the film Pokémon the Movie: Genesect and the Legend Awakened?

elements.title: Lawyering (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the beginning of Lawyering was compared to a Cinderella story?

elements.title: Kenny Motsamai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before the swearing-in of convicted murderer Kenny Motsamai as an MP, South African Chief Justice Mogoeng Mogoeng cited a constitutional requirement prohibiting felons from becoming MPs?

elements.title: Morris County Park Commission (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Morris County Park Commission in New Jersey oversees over 20,000 acres (8,100 ha) of land, including a marina, an ice skating arena, a horse stable, a historical farm, and a gristmill?

elements.title: Hana wa Dare no Mono? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first line to STU48's "Hana wa Dare no Mono?", which imagines a world without borders, is often misheard as wishing for a world without Tokyo?
